ygData.subject: Re: happenings
ygData.msgSnippet: Glad to know i am not the only one who has been through it *the person causing the stink was twinked to btw*  Anyway i have to say i dont sell gifts either i
ygData.messageBody:
Glad to know i am not the only one who has been through it *the person causing the stink was twinked to btw* Anyway i have to say i dont sell gifts either i pass them along to my needed guild members and with my wizard i have never been so lucky but i started a paladin bout a week ago and someone came up and ask me how they spoke with the shopkeep to sell, and i told them *they had been away for a long while* as i turned to leave they gave me all their armor and gold, i was floored when He started giving me the armor i told Him there was no way i could give him anything in return for the fact was i had nothing. Just the other day i had a person come up out of no where and give me a mino axe after asking me what weapon i was using. I have never been so lucky with one character :o)

truffle@... wrote:

> From: truffle@...
>
> I've had people who have yelled at me when I was trying to help them as well. I think their are a lot of reasons why this kind of thing happens:
>
> Many people are instinctively untrusting of other players because they expect them to kill steal, cheat, lie, and do anything they can to get more XP/loot.
>
> Many people don't feel that the social rules of normal society apply to online society, especially when they are playing a character. They feel disassociated from social responsibility because it's all not real.
>
> All you can do in this situation is state factually "I'm trying to help you, whether you believe it or not". If they're still abusive, they're really not worth helping! It sounds to me like your approach was quite reasonable.
>
> My own recent abusive story was as follows. I was fighting an aviak avocet in south karana, and I had to leave the zone, so I shouted 'avocet to lake rathe zone'. On the way out, the avocet got distracted and jumped on two people fighting a rook. I turned around, went into hand to hand combat to get the avocet off of them (taking massive damage in the process). I then ran the avocet away, doubled back, and bolted their rook to death because I knew, after the avocet was on them, they'd probably be too weak to finish this. After the fact, they accused me of trying to train the avocet onto them, and then trying to STEAL THEIR ROOK KILL (which I didn't). What really annoyed me was one of these people was someone I'd had a pleasent conversation or two with in the past. Luckily, most people in that zone know I'm a nice person (probably because I have a general policy of helping out anyone I see in hand to hand with an aviak, and I heal people who are badly hurt while fighting!
> ). So, when they started yelling in OOC about what they thought I was doing, people believed me when I explained what had really happened.
>
> On a last and completely unrelated note, I must admit with some embarassment that I accepted an expensive gift from a higher level druid last night. He gave me mamoth leggings and...I just couldn't turn them down. One rule I have which makes something like that much easier to bare, is that I will never sell any gift I'm given. Instead, I will try and give it to some worthy newbie (by worthy I mean untwinked and capable of role play). So, when I get those gator scale leggings, some druid newbie is going to get a nice surprise.
>
> - Christina
>
> > Hi everyone,
> >
> > I have a question for You all, i dont know if anyone else has
> > experianced this but well here goes. I wont go in to which server and
> > what characters but on the server that i play on a friend of mine was
> > accused of stealing from another player, they say they didnt see the
> > other person in the room and the other party involved swears on them
> > sitting on top of this item for some reason they have dropped in the
> > floor. Now for the reasons this was in the floor i still dont
> > understand. Now this is me but if something is laying there its open
> > for the taking people drop unwanted stuff all the time. I wont go into
> > all the deltails but there was a big todo about it and i was trying to
> > talk my friend into giving it back and had them talked into it when the
> > other party in question and their friends started threating. Ok now
> > this makes me angery be cause they threaten them with having a GM friend
> > delete their character. By this point i am angery one because i do what
> > ever i can to help people, so i let them know how stupid i though this
> > whole matter was to try to get someone deleted.... this lovely female if
> > she was inturn desided she wanted to call me a bitch while all along i
> > am trying to get her her things back in which i did. Now i will take
> > alot but that was something that was uncalled for me knowing if all of
> > them had just kept their mouths shut i could have gotten the stuff back
> > with out any furth happenings other than what had gone on before i
> > logged on. Has this happened to anyone else or is my server just full

> >
> > Page :o)
